document.title: Maryland World-Readiness Standards for Learning Languages

8E16CF564AAC4F8F9E456C96597E81C4.description:
Explore the Internet to find sites of personal interest where they can use
the target language to maintain and increase their communication skills.

5D38558C03F04AF1A8FCF0E3F7C5E33B.description:
Listen to music, sing songs, or play musical instruments from the target
culture.

EB1B8FA053DA4DB8A591EEC468873801.description: Attend or use media to view cultural events and social activities.

57FB0B75FA8C4F32AD44B48DF396909E.description:
Establish and/or maintain interpersonal relations with speakers of the
target language.

8B1AEB71191446F383E9BBE1B3F8246B.description:
Read and/or use various media from the target language and culture for
entertainment or personal growth.

76838F648851472993CD6CFF8D18F894.description: Play sports or games from the target culture.

CD68274BB1FF4E50BFC1D1551605653C.description:
Consult various sources in the target language to obtain information on
topics of personal interest.

58DE6BC344694256AFC889A79F074AE0.description:
Consult various sources in the target language to obtain information on
topics of personal interest.

6441130E50754951897D8B1A96918F22.description:
Collect evidence showing that they have achieved the SMART goals they
have set for each unit of instruction.

D4D4C4A6B01C431C88E4F67D55ABBD54.description:
Use the NCSSFL-ACTFL Can-Do Global Benchmarks to set SMART
goals (specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and timebound) to
monitor and reflect on their progress in communication skills.

9E0F683518D7467191E68CDFE09F1E11.description:
Explore the Internet to find sites of personal interest where they can use
the target language to maintain and increase their communication skills.

8EF85721B3224B9F87BDC118C7CD895B.description:
Listen to music, sing songs, or play musical instruments from the target
culture.

409E12D50B1C47B39C333C982CAA14DF.description: Attend or use media to view cultural events and social activities.Â

3F9DAC1DC8694FC5BF84EFC222561FDA.description: Use various media from the target language and culture for entertainment.

ADBADF026FB143388ABAE95C00021F39.description: Exchange information around topics of personal interest.

C1ED7642F17F41A19968857C110E90EF.description: Play sports or games from the target culture.

E4545E58AD8F471DA46820723D4C7D09.description:
Consult various sources in the target language to obtain information on
topics of personal interest.Â

29BA419B2BF5423397CA98D2015E4B6A.description:
Collect evidence showing that they have achieved the SMART goals they
have set for each unit of instruction.

9E2B8686B22949038BDA0FEF8EA3CB24.description:
Use the NCSSFL-ACTFL Can-Do Global Benchmarks to set SMART
goals (specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and timebound) to
monitor and reflect on their progress in communication skills.Â

9646076CC7A641AA84FD11F1A0079292.description:
Explore the Internet to find sites of personal interest where they can use
the target language to maintain and increase their communication skills.

F987045B0594468CB7A7042D49C9A3B2.description:
Listen to music, sing songs, or play musical instruments from the target
culture.

1D8FA6F43A5C421DB02D1B2CC05032B2.description: Attend or view via media cultural events and social activities.Â

44EFB72C01D341A2AE41FE42ED1E1B21.description: Exchange information about topics of personal interest.

D99EC74F287945988C18CC68BDE9409B.description: Play sports or games from the target culture.

95EAB04BBB114BD7A151B4FB47C3E02D.description:
Interpret materials and/or use media from the target language and culture
for enjoyment.

2069FBF0AB3547669E3F118BD82E6C82.description:
Collect evidence showing that they have achieved the SMART goals they
have set for each unit of instruction.

D72D8113AD8B49FF820EF5DE8992920D.description:
Use the NCSSFL-ACTFL Can-Do Global Benchmarks to set SMART
goals (specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and timebound) to
monitor and reflect on their progress in communication skills.

924711EB0C3D431F9DDD5719069E2550.description: LIFELONG LEARNING: Learners set goals and reflect on their progress in using language for enjoyment, enrichment, and advancement.

D76FA977ED874121A3C6266430584937.description:
Provide service to the community by interpreting the target language at
school, clinics, or daycare centers.

2E37A418F40D4C13950187279EF49C64.description: Read, add information, and monitor edits on wikis in the target language.Â

B6E976000D5F41909CB85BCFC00CC991.description: Write and illustrate stories to present to others.Â

D32FC08154AE4BE1967AC513AD30C74D.description:
Participate in language club activities which benefit the school or
community.

E10EE2B17D734E029E44AAD0DBB99F2C.description:
Design and organize a multimedia presentation about the target language
and culture to present to others.

994CDFAE16914A3CB0AFFF84D03410F5.description:
Use community resources to research a topic related to culture and/or
language study.

6595F22ED5E8481C83ABFD79FB61DE3B.description:
Participate in a career exploration or school-to-work project which
requires proficiency in the target language and culture.

43E1E6C6D29E4476A2E5C57EC03D84A1.description:
Communicate orally or in writing with members of the target culture
regarding topics of personal interest, community issues, or world concern.Â

B1C94C1A42D840528466094A792EF78A.description: Perform for a school, campus, or community celebration.

7C92C2ED955045ADA2F95CE57A2F52D5.description: Write and illustrate stories to present to others.

EB1F2122E0A54E2B81FB48611AB9C0E6.description:
Participate in language club activities which benefit the school or
community.

D21DB0AC3F38438F9994E0D2448BE2C6.description:
Interact with members of the local community or with contacts made
electronically to hear how they use the language in their various fields of
work.

4E92C269ABCE4BDD89894B893ACFC3C4.description:
Discuss their preferences concerning leisure activities and current events,
in written form or orally, with peers who speak the language.

52D615C2B2D1452C8420FF7B6C7ACC4C.description:
Use their knowledge of the target language to tutor English language
learners who speak the target language.

AD8905A8876949D9867AD0CA92A66E7A.description:
Present information gained from a native speaker about a cultural event
or a topic of interest.

956E9F49BABA4C35BA4A6C75955B9599.description:
Discuss steps to becoming a professional in a field requiring the ability to
communicate in the target language.

488B0E4779534E2E9285929359B1D19F.description:
Discuss their preferences in leisure activities and current events, in
written form or orally, with peers.Â

27776729F12A4C1E9C5E81267799A9E1.description: Perform for school, campus, or community celebrations.

B03E21FC7F48431FA08E802EBC89219C.description: Write and illustrate short stories to present to others.

BF83E9D3F9AA42DBB5A29EBEF98A9BA1.description: Do WebQuests and report on a cultural event or a school topic.

00BC43A8C03C467AAA70FA8F1190B4A4.description:
Create imaginary situations to role play interactions that might take place
in a community setting

A94789D8E92A4E9697660F3D2E633576.description: Identify professions which require proficiency in another language.

684F38612C514BA88CEC38527F235C0E.description:
Communicate on a personal level with speakers of the language in person
or via email, video chats, instant messaging, and shared video clips.

EE09EB8FAF0D4DF495304CF00ECF37ED.description: SCHOOL AND GLOBAL COMMUNITIES: Learners use the language both within and beyond the classroom to interact and collaborate in their community and the globalized world.

E620C23F34974A369ED45FCDBDB2A77D.description: COMMUNITIES: Learners communicate and interact with cultural competence in order to participate in multilingual communities at home and around the world.

D7225A3F8A6F46AC951D6110C3347146.description:
Identify, examine, and analyze the relationship between cultural products,
practices, and perspectives in the target culture and their own by
conducting research, observations, and interviews.

1FA087EB1A4B454EAEC2DFCBB504208F.description:
Identify, analyze, and discuss tangible and intangible products and their
use in the target culture and their own, as represented in authentic
materials (e.g., literary texts, films, social media, interviews, news
stories)

7F28A32910E349DFB69F74073B523DA7.description:
Identify, discuss, and analyze social, economic, and political institutions
and related perspectives in the target culture and their own.Â

DE827613142342C38123B4CBDC8767CA.description:
Compare cultural nuances of meanings of words, idioms, and vocal
inflections in the target language and their won.

67116C80909442548DA9FB52F9CE4BE6.description:
Hypothesize about the origins and use of idioms as reflections of culture,
citing examples from the language and culture being studied and their
own.

3B63502B73FF4ED08830596CD0DD5CD1.description:
Report on the relationship between word order and meaning and
hypothesize on how this may or may not reflect the ways in which
cultures organize information and view the world.

24E7F74F698E4C2ABEEDFC88213E9A2C.description:
Compare and contrast entertainment and leisure options in the target
culture and their own.

5E62AD1116B14C12AD0736ADB2A08F50.description:
Compare and contrast career choices and preparation in the target culture
to their own.

C4F05B349377411C915E83431FB35C94.description:
Compare and contrast the role of social networking in the target culture to
their own.

3A7B72680ACA4A0AAF2A7D98EA6733E2.description:
Compare and contrast school schedules, course offerings, and attitudes
toward school in the target culture to their own.

0D7325409422452EB4E61369BB221310.description:
Compare and contrast the role and importance of family in the target
culture to their own.

46B26AC26F874FEB8451E97979C2E8C7.description:
Hypothesize about the relationship between cultural perspectives and
expressive products (e.g., music, visual arts, forms of literature) by
analyzing selected products from the target culture and their own.

D695FBC83A194BC48A7CA79D84E93573.description:
Compare places in a city where the target language is spoken to places in
the city where they live.

50C0FB0EA8C24B409F6744E7ACF2FB9E.description: Compare meal time in their culture and the target culture.

D75A5E471FCC4A29B0D9D994C86C1CCD.description:
Compare celebrations (e.g., birthdays, holidays) in the target cultures to
their own.

52D1F4D04DA04085954C4C064EEA109F.description: Compare daily routines in their culture and the target culture.

0BCA50D7145244939D8D254325C09312.description:
Compare games, stories, songs, and rhymes from their childhood to those
in the target culture.Â

B440CBDFFD7D49C69DAB5222D5DFF9F5.description: CULTURAL COMPARISONS: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the concept of culture through comparisons of the cultures studied and their own.Â

23362E6CFD0C40ED9FA7A97D2A81C091.description:
Compare the writing system of the target language and their own. They
also examine other writing systems and report about the nature of those
writing systems (e.g., logographic, syllabic, alphabetic).

686D46C0EBE74414BAC663CBBCBA7412.description:
Report on the relationship between word order and meaning and
hypothesize on how this may or may not reflect the ways in which
cultures organize information and view the world.

9B2A8E2EBE9C4601B30D25E36589432F.description:
Analyze elements of the target language, such as time and tense and
comparable linguistic elements in English, and conjecture about how
languages use forms to express time and tense relationships.Â

7A9A1D998A8A42F3B57F325908E5B535.description:
Keep a journal of phrases and idioms that do not translate directly from
one language to another.

FC5C6B6F367645589B65819C659C01C9.description:
Recognize that cognates have the same as well as different meanings
among languages and speculate about the evolution of language.

45C6B8C88FB146CE83A37F73A14460F1.description: Compare the choice and use of prepositions among languages.

56697701EDBD4587AC319D7AFDB5B225.description:
Compare how different time frames are expressed in the target language
and their native language and describe the shades of meaning expressed
by such differences.

AD1F6AC1F6844F72A03D528495C849D7.description:
Match groups of people with ways of expressing respect and
communicating status differences in their own language and the language
they are learning.

5E3CF248995A4548807AAE01A0FE386F.description:
Hypothesize about the similarities of languages based on their awareness
of cognates and similar idioms.

1A46EBE4AADD452E9BB6FD8DAA3589E7.description:
Report differences and similarities between the sound and writing
systems of their own language and the language being learned.

AE2AFA7E26804A5AA59F423318289835.description:
Observe formal and informal forms of language in greetings and leavetakings and try out expressions of politeness in other languages and their
own.

2332B487B636407DB22EB3EC521E1260.description:
Compare word order in items such as the date and placement of
descriptors.

DF72114358934EE1B9C6BFBB5F490B68.description:
Inventory idiomatic expressions in both their native language and the
language being learned and talk about how idiomatic expressions work in
general.

8AEB90C157944AD0924D7808B2AB6292.description:
Identify cognates between the target language and their native language
and cite the patterns that connect them, and they detect false cognates
when the context in which they see them suggests a misfit.Â

02890F86507E41D0B9D14C3678176F54.description:
Cite and use examples of words that are similar in the language they are
learning and their native language and they pose guesses about why
languages in general might need to borrow words.

CC55013729554ACAB27C439FF39739D8.description: LANGUAGE COMPARISONS: Learners use the language to investigate, explain and reflect on the nature of language through comparisons of the language studied and their own.

1CB3E7464B1F4F79AE84261E01D9A9AD.description: COMPARISONS: Learners develop insight into the nature of language and culture in order to interact with cultural competence.

915A5ADF09824A48B4F67077CF926012.description:
Prepare a virtual exhibit of artwork from a country where the target
language is spoken, situating the contents historically, and explaining the
importance of the artwork in the country of origin.

ECFF54D3A53541DD9A8B564591878685.description:
Read a piece of literature in the target language and analyze the
universality of the message.

0B4652FD2EE647E9AD1A7921CFB1025C.description:
Research an issue of global importance in order to provide insights from
the perspective of a country or countries where the target language is
spoken.

E4D50F7428544D838E6AB510C0BD052A.description:
Compare listings of houses for sale in countries where the target
language is spoken in terms of what features are showcased, cost, size,
and location.

9DD0454BE94E4C2AA948FA32D48A59AC.description:
Compare news articles on front pages of newspapers from countries
where the target language is spoken.Â

300D8D3E18AC4AB1B546CD215AAE7B82.description:
View publicity for products sold in countries where the target language
is spoken and compare the publicity to the way similar products are
marketed in the United States.

A112F5D0908944B7B92E42A0EBA31B5D.description:
Access survey results about preferences related to daily life (e.g., music,
leisure activities, movies) of people in countries where the target
language is spoken and compare the results to preferences of people in
their community.

5D02E1BE32324650A5C110964E70C657.description:
Research how a major figure from history, science, or the arts is
described in the target language and use it to expand what they already
know.

F49920C5DBEB42CDB1A02880348CC661.description:
Access a current event article or broadcast on the web in the target
language and chart how it compares with the same event reported in the
United States.

76A707DDD28D40E4AB5BAC06D6197005.description:
View websites of schools in countries where the target language is
spoken to identify courses, schedules, and special projects, and compare
the information to their schoolâs website.

0DAF3791385A4EEBB65F2179118E2B5E.description:
Identify the main idea(s) of current events reported in the news in the
Internet from countries where the target language is spoken.

901E9E28D6814FBBBA83771D1A3CE167.description:
View video clips and identify ways that the people in the target culture
protect the environment on a daily basis.

A3F968E1D152440FAAA850BC7B6D3996.description:
Interpret the main idea(s) from infographics showing statistics such as
numbers of endangered animals, changes in population of cities and
countries, and popularity of various sports and leisure activities.

371EC6D876AB4584A495A75375C8129E.description: ACQUIRING INFORMATION AND DIVERSE PERSPECTIVES: Learners access and evaluate information and diverse perspectives that are available through the language and its cultures.

CD5A4E1E07C445EC9214DE7225703D15.description:
Write and produce an original play to highlight a challenge facing
people in countries where the target language is spoken.Â

7A2CCE19A44243F1A5D73C74B82235C2.description:
Create an innovation/invention to improve the quality of life of people
around the world.

266E918BD313409DA82D18BA1283306F.description:
Use their knowledge of different forms of government to compare how
leaders of countries where the target language is spoken are chosen or
elected.Â

B36F6F443AD742D8979A51FE219258D4.description:
Use their knowledge of subjects taught in their schools to tutor English
language learners whose first language is the target language.

3FE7E83B22EF4BA3A4B7FD6427CA861E.description:
Write a critical analysis of a movie from a country where the target
language is spoken.

DEF8A80F6D0B45828E1D0B5259CF1904.description:
Research and compare how countries where the target language is spoken
deal with environmental issues (such as water shortages).

753B56BF722B4971981854AFCD9B2B43.description:
Use technology to present representative examples of contemporary
culture (e.g., music, art, architecture) from countries where the target
language is spoken.

6A28BE5978D24F2DAC5BD15B306DCAAF.description:
Evaluate the role and importance of education for all children in countries
where the target language is spoken.

B974E9C3B02D4A698CE1E25961D3DB08.description:
Maintain a blog comparing attitudes and reactions to current events of
global importance in countries where the target language is spoken.

FE2F28F2D7EB4A2C93082187702B2710.description:
Report on and evaluate the effectiveness of efforts to protect the
environment in countries where the target language is spoken.

719EBFE7866E484BA89A0C9136B21F83.description:
Describe and compare key characteristics of countries where the target
language is spoken.

8051CBDF06A3420790C8F3E0BB3B3BA9.description:
Make oral or written presentations in the target language on topics being
studied in other classes.Â

0129E6FA552F4643A3D03C7969218FD2.description:
Seek out articles or multimedia in the target language on topics being
studied in other classes and enter notes on main ideas in a journal.

D55304AD11ED4502BEB6AF4C4966013F.description:
Use skills from social studies and English language arts to present short
biographical sketches of people from the past and present who have had a
positive influence locally and/or globally.Â

256869883CDD4990AA44AFA450CD5EE6.description:
Use knowledge from health and science classes to compare healthyeating recommendations using food pyramids or the equivalents from
countries in the target culture.

954B993BA3D54A10A99E75510A5B6FB1.description:
Use science knowledge and skills to record daily temperatures and
weather in different locations around the world, giving reasons for
temperatures based on location and time of year.

5E8C7A296AF04D95966908B52979E62F.description:
Use mathematics skills to convert weights and measures from the
American system to the metric system in order to understand distances,
sizes, and quantities of items.

7F9498FE8D624E2590C48D26657EEA39.description:
Use mathematics skills to convert American dollars to the currencies of
countries in the target culture in order to understand prices of items such
as clothing, tickets, and restaurant meals.Â

59983A56BA6C40F094658600A449542A.description: MAKING CONNECTIONS: Learners build, reinforce, and expand their knowledge of other disciplines while using the language to develop critical thinking and to solve problems creatively.

D65EC5BF32F64AAC8C847A953F014E4E.description: CONNECTIONS: Learners connect with other disciplines and acquire information and diverse perspectives in order to use the language to function in academic and career-related situations.Â

4058E40D074D4A1FBCFEC8203F146B5E.description:
Create cultural triangles connecting products to associated practices and
giving evidence-based insights to the cultural perspective.

D0FE183C30F9459689BFC74CB7C075A7.description:
Describe how some cultural products have changed or disappeared over
time.

AE2479F028634355926D0C5AF844505A.description:
Identify and analyze the role and importance of cultural products found in
literature, news stories, and film.

50134954D7CD4A91BDEC8244F86C9E2D.description:
Research in detail the role and importance of products from the target
culture.

8BFBAD96EC854AB79E4367D92F34AA5A.description:
Use evidence-based details to explain and analyze the historical, social,
economic, and/or political significance of products found in the target
culture.

A2D13861E8514C81AA95E1D0B58A5A20.description:
Create cultural triangles connecting products to associated practices along
with suggested perspectives based on background information.

6FF47B8DFB76400E8551611762A8E6F9.description:
Identify and analyze cultural products found in literature, news stories,
and films from the target culture.

DB973999A25C477EA0B20FCA7D3511EA.description:
Experience (read, listen to, observe, perform) expressive products of the
target culture (e.g., stories, poetry, music, paintings, dance, drama) and
explain the origin and importance of these products in todayâs culture.

63BC79FCA5B34A2697C7486289ED38B1.description:
Make simple cultural triangles connecting products to associated
practices and possible perspectives.

C85F7F1573864446BB20C50702403A30.description:
Listen to and/or read short poems, stories, or plays from the target
culture, identifying the author and country of origin.

C7C0BB816A634749863B23ACA2C507A6.description:
Give simple reasons for the role and importance of products from the
target culture.

AB15599B8016479AB40D0E7B96D42ED2.description:
Identify, discuss, and produce types of artwork, crafts, or graphic
representations enjoyed or made by their peer group within the target
culture such as models of monuments, mosaics, murals, and traditional
recipes.

0F20863D79E54A26936735B75F11E641.description:
Identify and observe tangible products of the target culture such as toys,
dress, homes, monuments, currency, famous people, and art.

C52446FA997748EC8546D7A7A525791B.description:
RELATING CULTURAL PRODUCTS TO PERSPECTIVES: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between the products and perspectives of the cultures
studied.

A3CB40539DE7446D89B2C34D3DB634AA.description:
Connect practices to associated products, giving evidence-based reasons
for the perspectives proposed.

64BABD9BDDD7448C9704EDBFC2FD7C0C.description:
Adjust language, behaviors, and messages to acknowledge audiences with
different cultural backgrounds.

42544AE51B564DEBBF235D3F59B52076.description:
Use culturally appropriate behaviors in a variety of situations in the target
culture.

5F630FEC7F904F45A312BCB0E8B0572A.description:
Engage in conversations with native speakers in a culturally respectful
way.Â

4FDCD28F864746648FE300FC7F6DB2EF.description: Use formal and informal forms of address appropriately.

7AA8A1069ACC45D0A4EFD197FA1D5569.description:
Suggest cultural triangles with reasons connecting practices to associated
products and perspectives.

AE9E4B70B4904A95B81BFB91CE758D9E.description:
Begin to adjust language and message to acknowledge audiences with
different cultural backgrounds.

6F25F54B338E48F69E0E58707DAE5A74.description:
Role play culturally appropriate interactions with service personnel (e.g.,
shopkeepers) in the target culture.

946A8A0BEE354309A96D56F69EF4E22B.description:
Use formal and informal forms of address appropriately in rehearsed
situations.

44D0E3DEDDC445C3BA1F89BDFC18282C.description:
Engage in conversations with native speakers demonstrating an
awareness of how to be culturally respectful.

45BBFFCB4F804922987CAA3FF3417EFB.description:
Identify and analyze cultural practices from authentic materials such as
videos and news articles.

C146C03C4D9B4812952A365EAD41EED7.description:
Participate in age-appropriate cultural practices such as games (e.g., role
of leader, taking turns), sports, and entertainment (e.g., music, dance,
drama).

F118390269094C0AACE6DD5D5F2C97C2.description:
Observe, analyze, and exchange information on patterns of behavior
typical of their peer group in the culture, such as observing and analyzing
how different ways of greeting and leave-taking reflect the relationships
between people in the target culture.

01F2C8A594B8430581CA43F3B1F9B7B0.description:
Role play simple interactions in stores and restaurants in the target
culture.

7CC95B5CF1C24644AEA1742C31DAFBEE.description: List practices observed in a video of a practice from the target culture.Â

C4BB413463614CD1BBA2ED224D86D13C.description: Imitate appropriate etiquette from the target culture at mealtime.

69746F8830F74D33A61765EE25651C41.description:
Create or propose simple cultural triangles connecting practices to
associated products and perspectives.Â

2E5ED66BA79E4498BB8DED72A4E54C18.description:
Participate in or simulate age-appropriate cultural activities such as
games, birthday celebrations, storytelling, and dramatizations.

447B510967084D60AA3D647E266D5C06.description:
Use appropriate gestures and oral expressions for greetings, leave
takings, and common classroom or social interactions.Â

93C7E6BE7A1E43B093D1EC5B952A3B60.description: RELATING CULTURAL PRACTICES TO PERSPECTIVES: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between the practices and perspectives of the cultures studied.

B834BFF3568144C687ACB75B89CE4FC5.description: CULTURES: Learners interact with cultural competence and understanding.Â
